title: Configure Elastic Agent for Log and Metric Collection
content: Elastic Agent is a unified agent for collecting logs, metrics, and security data from your hosts. Configure inputs in the agent policy to specify which data to collect and where to send it.

title: Manage Elastic Agents with Fleet
content: Fleet provides centralized management for Elastic Agents. Create agent policies, deploy integrations, and monitor agent health from a single interface.

title: Installing Elastic Agent on Linux
content: Download and install Elastic Agent on Linux hosts. The agent can be enrolled in Fleet for centralized management or run in standalone mode with local configuration.

title: Elastic Agent Input Configuration
content: Configure agent inputs to collect specific data types. Inputs define what data to collect, including file paths for logs, metrics endpoints, and data processing options.

title: Configuring Agent Outputs
content: Configure where Elastic Agent sends collected data. Outputs can be Elasticsearch clusters, Logstash, or other destinations. Set up authentication and TLS for secure connections.

title: Agent Policies and Integrations
content: Agent policies define the configuration for a group of agents. Add integrations to collect data from specific sources like system metrics, Nginx logs, or Kubernetes.

title: Monitoring Agent Health
content: Monitor Elastic Agent health and performance in Fleet. View agent status, check for errors, and troubleshoot connectivity issues from the Fleet UI.

title: Upgrading Elastic Agent
content: Upgrade Elastic Agents to the latest version using Fleet. Fleet supports rolling upgrades with automatic rollback on failure to ensure continuous data collection.

title: Getting Started with Agent Builder
content: Agent Builder is a tool for creating LLM-powered agents that can perform complex tasks. Build agents that use tools, maintain conversation context, and integrate with your data.

title: Agent Builder Configuration
content: Configure your Agent Builder agents with custom workflows, tools, and prompts. Define how agents process requests, call tools, and generate responses.

title: Adding Tools to Your Agent
content: Extend agent capabilities by adding tools. Tools allow agents to search data, call APIs, execute code, and perform actions beyond text generation.

title: Prompt Engineering for Agents
content: Write effective system prompts for your agents. Good prompts define agent behavior, set boundaries, and improve response quality and consistency.

title: Agent Memory Configuration
content: Configure memory for your agents to maintain conversation context. Choose between short-term conversation memory and long-term persistent memory for user preferences.

title: Deploying Your Agent
content: Deploy agents to production environments. Configure scaling, monitoring, and failover for reliable agent operation under load.

title: Debugging Agent Workflows
content: Debug agent behavior by inspecting tool calls, prompts, and responses. Use the Agent Builder debugger to step through agent execution and identify issues.
